meanings.definition: To make (something) plastic, especially by the addition of a plasticizer.
meanings.sent1: She used a special chemical to plasticize the clay for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The factory workers plasticize the raw material to create durable toys.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to plasticize the playing cards, but they kept turning into rubber ducks!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to plasticize the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly, skillfully plasticizing the soft material into intricate shapes.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the heat caused the plastic to plasticize and change shape.
meanings.sent2: The clay will plasticize when water is added, making it easier to sculpt.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers allowed him to plasticize his body, stretching and reshaping at will.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to plasticize, adapting to new ideas and perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The old rubber band started to plasticize in the sun, losing its elasticity.
